intro: Gyrostemon racemigerus, commonly known as the mountain gum, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Its fruits are woody capsules that release seeds when mature. Gyrostemon racemigerus plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
